page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 4  Types of porches and entry ways

A  Roofed porch

B  Roofed entry way
(not vaulted)

C  Vaulted entry way

D  Combination porch & vaulted entry way

See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13

Height less than 12" above grade
Height greater than 12" above grade
Height greater than 12" above grade

visual_elements.description: Four architectural line drawings illustrating different types of porches and entry ways: (A) Roofed porch showing a single-story porch with a roof supported by columns; (B) Roofed entry way (not vaulted) showing a house front with a small roofed entry door with height less than 12 inches above grade; (C) Vaulted entry way showing a house front with a vaulted entry door with height greater than 12 inches above grade; (D) Combination porch & vaulted entry way showing a porch with arches and a vaulted entry door with height greater than 12 inches above grade. Each drawing includes a vertical measurement line indicating height relative to grade, with annotations specifying "Height less than 12" above grade" or "Height greater than 12" above grade."
visual_elements.location: Centered on the page, with two drawings on top row (A left, C right) and two on bottom row (B left, D right)

visual_elements.description: A grey shaded box containing the text: "See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13"
visual_elements.location: Center of the page, between the top and bottom rows of drawings

technical_specifications.parameter: Height of porch or entry feature

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 4  Types of porches and entry ways

additional_notes: No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings detected.
Page layout consists of four labeled architectural drawings arranged in two rows with a central text box.
Text is clear and legible with no quality issues.
cross_references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13
